intro: Sida yunnanensis var. xichangensis, commonly known as the Xichang sida, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting well to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
